revised_title: Ionospheric Phenomena Observed at Halley Bay During the International Geophysical Year
tldr: The article discusses the ionospheric phenomena observed at Halley Bay, Antarctica, during the International Geophysical Year. The authors describe the location and unique features of Halley Bay, such as its small magnetic dip and high latitude. They also present the results of ionospheric experiments conducted at the base, including the measurements of virtual heights, electron densities, and ionospheric drift velocities. The study highlights the differences in ionospheric behavior at Halley Bay compared to lower latitudes and the importance of movements of ionization in the ionosphere.
